title: 112_hr2275
content: The Act is known as the "American Textile Technology Innovation and Research for Exportation (ATTIRE) Act". It includes findings related to textile technology and innovation. The Congress finds that the United States textile industry is thriving and evolving, employing over 500,000 workers and contributing nearly $60 billion to the GDP annually. It is a primary supplier of jobs to women and minorities, with a focus on research, innovation, and international expansion. University-based textile research programs and not-for-profit centers are crucial for promoting innovation and growth in the textile industry and the US economy. Grant program established to support textile research and innovation through university and industry collaboration. The Secretary of Commerce has established a grant program to fund textile research and innovation, with eligibility limited to higher education and not-for-profit research institutions. Preference is given to collaborative research organizations emphasizing peer-reviewed research by academic and industry experts. Applications for grants must be submitted according to specified procedures. The grant program established by the Secretary of Commerce requires applications to be submitted according to specified procedures and undergo a rigorous peer review process. The funds are to be used for research and development activities aimed at enhancing innovation, competitiveness, and flexibility in the U.S. textile industry, including the development of new materials and technologies. The grant program aims to discover, design, and develop new materials and manufacturing systems for the textile industry, train personnel, establish partnerships, strengthen research and educational efforts, and create domestic jobs. No more than 75% of funding can go to higher education institutions. The Secretary of Commerce has the authority to waive the limitation on funds disbursed to higher education institutions if necessary to ensure all appropriated funds are used in a fiscal year. Authorization of Appropriations: $5,000,000 is authorized to the Secretary of Commerce for fiscal year 2013. This amount is available until expended. Additionally, there is a reduction of $5,000,000 in the authorization of appropriations for the International Trade Administration's operations and administration in the Department of Commerce for the same fiscal year.
